Best regards,

Dear Jackie

 

We’ve followed up with GIG regarding the rates; unfortunately, they are unable to offer a reduction due to the vehicle being a Chinese electric model.

 

Regarding the NEO vehicle, GIG is currently only able to provide Third Party Liability (TPL) coverage.

 

In order to consider extending comprehensive coverage to NEO vehicles, GIG has requested further clarity on post-claim support—specifically, the name of the service provider responsible for repairs, as well as the spare parts costs. This information is essential for their claims team’s assessment.

In order to consider extending comprehensive coverage to NEO vehicles, GIG has requested further clarity on post-claim support—specifically, the name of the service provider responsible for repairs, as well as the spare parts costs. This information is essential for their claims team’s assessment.

 

Please note that the rating for these vehicles will not align with the agreed fleet terms.

 

As discussed, earlier the fleet dynamics was focused on adding well-known brands such as Chevrolet, Tesla, and more recently, BYD—backed by Al Futtaim. Insurers value the level of support provided by recognized showrooms like Al Futtaim and Al Nabooda during claims, which has positively influenced underwriting decisions.

 

Since they do not have any visibility on the coming Chinese vehicles, they either decline to provide a comprehensive cover or the rates are high.

 

On the alternate options, at this time, SUKOON Insurance is not extending coverage to rental car companies, and LIVA is currently unable to onboard with these vehicles. 

 

 

 

Best Regards,

	Dear Jackie

	 

	We’ve followed up with GIG regarding the rates; unfortunately, they are unable to offer a reduction due to the vehicle being a Chinese electric model.

	 

	Regarding the NEO vehicle, GIG is currently only able to provide Third Party Liability (TPL) coverage.

	 

	In order to consider extending comprehensive coverage to NEO vehicles, GIG has requested further clarity on post-claim support—specifically, the name of the service provider responsible for repairs, as well as the spare parts costs. This information is essential for their claims team’s assessment.

	 

	Please note that the rating for these vehicles will not align with the agreed fleet terms.

chunks.text:
In order to consider extending comprehensive coverage to NEO vehicles, GIG has requested further clarity on post-claim support—specifically, the name of the service provider responsible for repairs, as well as the spare parts costs. This information is essential for their claims team’s assessment.

	 

	Please note that the rating for these vehicles will not align with the agreed fleet terms.

	 

	As discussed, earlier the fleet dynamics was focused on adding well-known brands such as Chevrolet, Tesla, and more recently, BYD—backed by Al Futtaim. Insurers value the level of support provided by recognized showrooms like Al Futtaim and Al Nabooda during claims, which has positively influenced underwriting decisions.

	 

	Since they do not have any visibility on the coming Chinese vehicles, they either decline to provide a comprehensive cover or the rates are high.

	 

	On the alternate options, at this time, SUKOON Insurance is not extending coverage to rental car companies, and LIVA is currently unable to onboard with these vehicles.

chunks.text:
We’ve followed up with GIG regarding the rates; unfortunately, they are unable to offer a reduction due to the vehicle being a Chinese electric model.

		 

		Regarding the NEO vehicle, GIG is currently only able to provide Third Party Liability (TPL) coverage.

		 

		In order to consider extending comprehensive coverage to NEO vehicles, GIG has requested further clarity on post-claim support—specifically, the name of the service provider responsible for repairs, as well as the spare parts costs. This information is essential for their claims team’s assessment.

		 

		Please note that the rating for these vehicles will not align with the agreed fleet terms.

		 

		As discussed, earlier the fleet dynamics was focused on adding well-known brands such as Chevrolet, Tesla, and more recently, BYD—backed by Al Futtaim. Insurers value the level of support provided by recognized showrooms like Al Futtaim and Al Nabooda during claims, which has positively influenced underwriting decisions.

		 

		Since they do not have any visibility on the coming Chinese vehicles, they either decline to provide a comprehensive cover or the rates are high.

		 

		On the alternate options, at this time, SUKOON Insurance is not extending coverage to rental car companies, and LIVA is currently unable to onboard with these vehicles. 

		 

		 

		 

		Best Regards,

		 

		Mridul Nambiar M.B.A CII (AWARD) 

		Assistant Manager - Motor

		
		

		
		Nasco Middle East
		P.O. Box 62528, Dubai, UAE
